alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 4:09AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Delaware and north central Sullivan Counties through 445 AM EDT... At 409 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Harvard, or 11 miles south of Walton, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Andes, Margaretville, Fleischmanns, Arkville, Fishs Eddy, Harvard, Downsville, Corbett, East Branch and Roscoe. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 89 and 93. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
